channel.title: Event System
channel.description:
Working on an event system for RSCD, which I will later switch over to RSCBase once RSCB is to the stage where I'm adding content.
ATM, most of the GUI is done.
You can view current progress at: http://google.com/applets/EventSystem.html
Note: I will be updating it every time I stop for the day, or finish something.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 28, 2009, 07:05:30 pm[/size][hr]Most of GUI is done.
Site updated.
Temp bug: White backgrounds on check boxes/radio buttons

item.title: Event System
item.dc:creator: @Peter Peeter
item.description:
@Peter wrote:

[quote=“CodeForFame, post:18, topic:316910”][quote author=Peeter link=topic=413478.msg3056102#msg3056102 date=1260486600]

And what happens when you run a Linux server with no GUI? Or you can not access remote desktop from the PC you’re currently on?

Would’ve been a better idea (both exp. wise and compatibility wise) to write the front end in PHP (Send packets to login-server/server that handles the rest of the logic).

The GUI is an applet you can run from the website…

I know how to open, and write sockets from php…

So its a standalone GUI? Not connected to the server?
[/quote]
Correct, you set the port and ip and it sends the info.[/quote]

Still would’ve gone with a web based one, would’ve looked cleaner and nicer (and smaller if you launch it from a mobile phone):>

Read full topic

item.description:
@Mind_Freak44 wrote:

[quote=“CodeForFame, post:12, topic:316910”][quote author=zeriasis2 link=topic=413478.msg3055202#msg3055202 date=1260400304]
so whats the progress on rscbase

[/quote]
It’s on pause until this is done. All I have left to do on this is the server side, and I’ve been busy the last couple days and haven’t had time.[/quote]

Take your time, but we will be waiting

item.title: Event System
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

object:

CodeForFame: About your so called “bug”. Just set the background-color of each and every JCheckBox and JRadioButton (assuming you’re using Swing-components only), to the right one. That should fix it.

I already did… I forgot to set them when I put that version up.

Read full topic

item.title: Event System
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

Almost have everything up and running…

Got my new mobo, and cpu installed with ubuntu on it.

And got my laptop working… Had a stupid BSOD with unmountable boot volume, and no way to get to the command line, lol.

Read full topic
